thread.title: Raptors Secure Hard-Earned 97-95 Victory Against Pacers
thread.title_full: Raptors Secure Hard-Earned 97-95 Victory Against Pacers

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Raptors Secure Hard-Earned 97-95 Victory Against Pacers
text:
Raptors Secure Hard-Earned 97-95 Victory Against Pacers
The Toronto Raptors secured a narrow 97-95 victory against the Indiana Pacers, overcoming poor shooting performance that saw them hit just 5-of-25 from beyond the arc. With the game tied and seconds ticking down, Brandon Ingram made the decisive shot, marking his first game-winner since joining the Raptors. Torontoâ€™s win improved their record to 14-5 and furthered their perfect 4-0 standing in the NBA Cup. Despite underwhelming offense, the Raptors showcased resilience and adaptability, crucial for their ongoing success.
- Raptors shot 38.9% overall and 20% on three-pointers.
- Brandon Ingram scored 26 points, including the game-winning shot.
- Scottie Barnes led with 24 points and a career-high 14 free throws made.
- Raptors extended their winning streak to 9 games, their best since a record 15 straight in 2019-20.
- They currently sit in second place in the Eastern Conference.
- RJ Barrett remains day-to-day with a knee sprain, while rookie Collin Murray-Boyles has been trying to secure a starting role.
Following a strong performance in the NBA Cup, the Raptors aim to maintain momentum as they anticipate a home game in the quarterfinals. Continued emphasis on defensive play while improving offensive consistency will be critical for the team. Player health, particularly Barrett's status, will significantly impact their strategy moving forward.
Bottom LineDespite subpar shooting, the Raptors exemplified winning through tenacity and teamwork, vital for any championship aspirations. Their ability to adapt in challenging situations has proved essential, and sustaining this mindset is key to their continued success in a competitive season.
Read more at Sportsnet.ca
